text:
This ALWAYS takes me back to when I was a kid renting Chrono Trigger for the SNES and playing it for hours and hours straight and grinding level ups/techniques! My parents went ahead and just bought the game outright since it was from a "Mom and Pop" video store in my home town. 

Truly amazing times that you don't think will pass but you blink and you're in your 30s lol.

author: Heruru Meruru

text:
I never got to play this game as a kid. I eventually got the DS version.
It's funny, most people's opinions on games are bias and clouded by feelings of nostalgia. I have no nostalgic connection to this game, for better or worse, and yet I still loved it. I don't know if I would call it THE BEST game of its kind, I'm no RPG veteran. But, it did impress me quite a bit, for all that's worth, and I really wish I had played it as a kid. Really great game.
author: Auraleaf

text: My ex girlfriend played this game in her mid 20s, with no memory or nostalgia from playing it in her youth.  She loved it.  Chrono Trigger is one of those rare pieces of work that stands the test of time.
author: Dessa

text: @Dessa I'm playing it right now in my 20s. So far its a fantastic RPG.
author: Raging Light

text: Thats not something new lol I got Chrono Trigger for my 15th birthday last April and just beat it a week ago.  BOOM 2nd favorite game haha
author: That70sGamer1

text: @TimeyWimeyAura Not the best RPG, but the best JRPG. I can`t think of any other JRPG better than CT.
author: Jardeson Barbosa

text: @TimeyWimeyAura  I have to agree with TRexTurtle here. It's not nostalgia, it's just that those games ARE really good. I have to play Chrono Trigger and Super Metroid, but I'm pretty sure I won't be disapointed. I'm still playing most of my childhood SNES games, some of those are masterpieces (aLttP, Illusion of Gaia, SoM, Pocky & Rocky, SC IV, UN Squadron/Area 88, Axelay to name a few SNES games), and I know I'm not just biased, because I'm still finding incredible games. I recently played Demon's Crest on an emulator... oh boy. Gotta find that nearly 100$ cartdridge. And I don't wish I played those as a kid, because enjoying those games now as grown-ups proves that we're not just old farts blinded by nostalgia ;).
author: Clebardman

text: I found a Jet Force Gemini cartdrige for my 64 recently, nostalgia level was over 9000 for like... ten seconds. Then the game grabbed me and there was no room left for anything else than quality entertainment.

text: @SupraDarky, Thank you for posting these, I am a Landscape Architect and spend countless hours in studio, and I find that your playlists are the absolute perfect background noise for the creative process.  Many songs in video games are meant to be in the background and not be too distracting, and this is stuff is just perfect!  I've shown many people your page. Keep it up!

text:
Alright well I had a very busy week, everything should be back to normal now.
